title: C Andrew Basham
text: Research Fellow in Medicine, Harvard Medical School

title: Projects
text: Descriptive and causal inference about post-critical illness survivor health, quality of life, and socioeconomic outcomes;

title: Projects
text: Descriptive and causal inference about post-critical illness survivor health, quality of life, and socioeconomic outcomes;

title: Projects
text:
Foundations for Pharmacoequity:
Data provenance, lineage, and epidemiological analysis methods for health equity, focusing on race and ethnicity data use in pharmacoepidemiology;

title: Projects
text:
Causing Careers:
epidemiological approaches to education and career planning, delivery, and evaluation.

Funding: Brigham and Women’s Hospital Health Equity Innovation Pilot ($40,000)
Role: Research Lead
- Investigate structural missingness of race and ethnicity in EHR and claims data, comparing missing vs non-missing sociodemographics, health conditions, healthcare utilization. - Evaluate concordance of race and ethnicity in claims data compared with EHR data. - Document race and ethnicity variables available in Medicare, Medicaid benefits, and MGB EHR.



Funding: None
Role: Principal Investigator
- Create a tutorial on multilevel and mixed effects modeling. - Develop a participatory workshop. - Build an online learning community for mixed effects and multilevel modeling in pharmacoepidemiology.






07/2021
Towards survivorship epidemiology: a post-doctoral fellowship application
Brigham and Women’s Hospital, Boston, MA
12/2022
Trends and characteristics of tramadol utilization in the United States, 2004-2021
Brigham and Women’s Hospital, Boston, MA
03/2023
Diseases as drugs: a target trial emulation framework for survivorship epidemiology
Brigham and Women’s Hospital, Boston, MA
10/2023
Foundations for Pharmacoequity: Missing and misclassified race and ethnicity in linked electronic health records
Brigham and Women’s Hospital, Boston, MA

title: Curriculum Vitae
text:
Selected Publications

Basham CA, Romanowski K, Johnston JC. “Life after tuberculosis: planning for health.” Lancet Respiratory Medicine, 2019.
Basham CA, Cook VJ, Johnston JC. “Towards a ‘fourth 90’: A population-based analysis of post-tuberculosis pulmonary function testing.” European Respiratory Journal, 2020.
Basham CA, Karim ME, Cook VJ, Patrick DM, Johnston JC. “Post–tuberculosis mortality risk among immigrants to British Columbia, Canada.” Canadian Journal of Public Health, 2021.
Basham CA, Karim ME, Cook VJ, Johnston JC. “Tuberculosis-associated depression risk: a cohort study.” Annals of Epidemiology, 2021.

title: Curriculum Vitae
text:
Funded Projects

“Foundations for Pharmacoequity” (10/2023–ongoing): Brigham and Women’s Hospital Health Equity Innovation Pilot ($40,000)

Investigating missing race and ethnicity data in linked EHR and Medicaid/Medicare claims data.

“Multilevel Regression Analysis” (10/2023–ongoing): Developing a tutorial on drug utilization trend analysis and a workshop (unfunded).

text:

Oral Presentation (10/2023): “Foundations for Pharmacoequity: Missing race and ethnicity data,” Brigham and Women’s Hospital
